author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of the city police arrested a 50-year-old woman on charges of cheating several persons including doctors of crores of rupees by promising them post-graduation seats in medical colleges and government jobs through the Tamil Nadu Public Services Commission (TNPSC)

P.Lalitha (50), a resident of Vadapalani, and her husband Ponraj run a multi-cuisine restaurant and lodge at Kundrathur Main road.

Police said that recently, Neelakandan, an Anna Nagar-based doctor lodged a complaint stating that Lalitha had taken Rs. 26 lakh from him, promising to make his son, Kumaraguru Raja, a doctor, and ensure he cleared the TNPSC exams and became a deputy collector.

As she did not return the money or get the job, he lodged a police complaint. During investigations it was found that she had cheated several others in a similar manner. She had cheated two other doctors, Suresh and Raja Manikandan, of Rs. 24 lakh by promising them a PG seat.
title: Woman held for cheating doctors
